member.summary: Creates a new PlayerToSpectatorRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The object corresponding to the Room in which the player should be turned to spectator. If null, the last Room joined by the user is used (default = null).

member.summary: See PlayerToSpectatorRequest(Room) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.PrivateMessageRequest
member.summary: Sends a private chat message.
member.remarks: The private message is dispatched to a specific user, who can be in any server Room, or even in no Room at all. The message is delivered by means of the event. It is also returned to the sender: this allows showing the messages in the correct order in the application interface. It is also possible to send an optional object together with the message: it can contain custom parameters useful to transmit, for example, additional informations related to the message, like the text font or color, or other formatting details.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.PrivateMessageRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject)
member.summary: Creates a new PrivateMessageRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The message to be sent to to the recipient user.
The id of the user to which the message is to be sent.
An instance of containing additional custom parameters to be sent to the message recipient (for example the color of the text, etc). Default value is null.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.PrivateMessageRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: See PrivateMessageRequest(string, int, ISFSObject) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.PublicMessageRequest
member.summary: Sends a public chat message.
member.remarks:
A public message is dispatched to all the users in the specified Room, including the message sender (this allows showing messages in the correct order in the application interface); the corresponding event is the event. It is also possible to send an optional object together with the message: it can contain custom parameters useful to transmit, for example, additional informations related to the message, like the text font or color, or other formatting details.
In case the target Room is not specified, the message is sent in the last Room joined by the sender.
NOTE: the event is dispatched if the Room is configured to allow public messaging only (see the RoomSettings.Permissions parameter).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.PublicMessageRequest.#ctor(System.String,Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject,Sfs2X.Entities.Room)
member.summary: Creates a new PublicMessageRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The message to be sent to all the users in the target Room.
An instance of containing additional custom parameters to be sent to the message recipients (for example the color of the text, etc). Default value is null.
The object corresponding to the Room where the message should be dispatched; if null, the last Room joined by the user is used (default = null).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.PublicMessageRequest.#ctor(System.String,Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject)
member.summary: See PublicMessageRequest(string, ISFSObject, Room) constructor.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.PublicMessageRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: See PublicMessageRequest(string, ISFSObject, Room) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomEvents
member.summary: The RoomEvents class contains a specific subset of the RoomSettings required to create a Room.
member.remarks: This class defines which events related to the Room will be fired by the SmartFox client.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomEvents.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new RoomEvents instance.
member.remarks: The RoomSettings.Events property must be set to this instance during Room creation.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomEvents.AllowUserEnter
member.summary: Indicates whether the event should be dispatched whenever a user joins the Room or not.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomEvents.AllowUserExit
member.summary: Indicates whether the event should be dispatched whenever a user leaves the Room or not.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomEvents.AllowUserCountChange
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the event should be dispatched whenever the users (or players+spectators) count changes in the Room.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomEvents.AllowUserVariablesUpdate
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the event should be dispatched whenever a user in the Room updates his User Variables.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomExtension
member.summary: The RoomExtension class contains a specific subset of the RoomSettings required to create a Room.
member.remarks:
This class defines which server-side Extension should be attached to the Room upon creation.
The client can communicate with the Room Extension by means of the request.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomExtension.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new RoomExtension instance.
member.remarks: The RoomSettings.Extension property must be set to this instance during Room creation.
member.param: The name of the Extension as deployed on the server; it's the name of the folder containing the Extension classes inside the main [sfs2x-install-folder]/SFS2X/extensions folder.
The fully qualified name of the main class of the Extension.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomExtension.Id
member.summary: Returns the name of the Extension to be attached to the Room.
member.remarks: This is the name of the server-side folder containing the Extension classes inside the main [sfs2x-install-folder]/SFS2X/extensions folder.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomExtension.ClassName
member.summary: Returns the fully qualified name of the main class of the Extension.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomExtension.PropertiesFile
member.summary: Defines the name of an optional properties file that should be loaded on the server-side during the Extension initialization.
member.remarks: The file must be located in the server-side folder containing the Extension classes.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomPermissions
member.summary: The RoomPermissions class contains a specific subset of the RoomSettings required to create a Room.
member.remarks: This class defines which operations users will be able to execute on the Room after its creation.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomPermissions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new RoomPermissions instance.
member.remarks: The RoomSettings.Permissions property must be set to this instance during Room creation.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomPermissions.AllowNameChange
member.summary: Indicates whether changing the Room name after its creation is allowed or not.
member.remarks:
The Room name can be changed by means of the request.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomPermissions.AllowPasswordStateChange
member.summary: Indicates whether changing (or removing) the Room password after its creation is allowed or not.
member.remarks:
The Room password can be changed by means of the request.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomPermissions.AllowPublicMessages
member.summary: Indicates whether users inside the Room are allowed to send public messages or not.
member.remarks:
Public messages can be sent by means of the request.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomPermissions.AllowResizing
member.summary: Indicates whether the Room capacity can be changed after its creation or not.
member.remarks:
The capacity is the maximum number of users and spectators (in Game Rooms) allowed to enter the Room. It can be changed by means of the request.
The default value is false.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings
member.summary: The RoomSettings class is a container for the settings required to create a Room.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new RoomSettings instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the class constructor.
member.param: The name of the Room to be created.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.Name
member.summary: Defines the name of the Room.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.Password
member.summary: Defines the password of the Room.
member.remarks:
If the password is set to an empty string, the Room won't be password protected.
The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.IsGame
member.summary: Indicates whether the Room is a Game Room or not.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.MaxUsers
member.summary: Defines the maximum number of users allowed in the Room.
member.remarks:
In case of Game Rooms, this is the maximum number of players.
The default value is 10.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.MaxVariables
member.summary: Defines the maximum number of Room Variables allowed for the Room.
member.remarks: The default value is 5.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.MaxSpectators
member.summary: Defines the maximum number of spectators allowed in the Room (only for Game Rooms).
member.remarks: The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.Variables
member.summary: Defines a list of RooomVariable objects to be attached to the Room.
member.remarks: The default value is null.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.Permissions
member.summary: Defines the flags indicating which operations are permitted on the Room.
member.remarks:
Permissions include: name and password change, maximum users change and public messaging. If set to null, the permissions configured on the server-side are used (see the SmartFoxServer 2X Administration Tool documentation).
The default value is null.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.Events
member.summary: Defines the flags indicating which events related to the Room are dispatched by the SmartFox client.
member.remarks:
Room events include: users entering or leaving the room, user count change and user variables update. If set to null, the events configured on the server-side are used (see the SmartFoxServer 2X Administration Tool documentation).
The default value is null.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.Extension
member.summary: Defines the Extension that must be attached to the Room on the server-side, and its settings.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.GroupId
member.summary: Defines the id of the Group to which the Room should belong.
member.remarks:
If the Group doesn't exist yet, a new one is created before assigning the Room to it.
The default value is default.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings.AllowOwnerOnlyInvitation
member.summary: Specifies if the Room allows "Join Room" invitations to be sent by any user or just by its owner.
member.remarks: The default value is true.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.SetRoomVariablesRequest
member.summary: Sets one or more custom Room Variables in a Room.
member.remarks: When a Room Variable is set, the event is dispatched to all the users in the target Room, including the user who updated it. Also, if the Room Variable is global (see the class description), the event is dispatched to all users who subscribed the Group to which the target Room is associated.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.SetRoomVariablesRequest.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Sfs2X.Entities.Variables.RoomVariable},Sfs2X.Entities.Room)
member.summary: Creates a new SetRoomVariablesRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: A collection of objects representing the Room Variables to be set.
An object representing the Room where to set the Room Variables; if null, the last Room joined by the current user is used (default = null).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.SetRoomVariablesRequest.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Sfs2X.Entities.Variables.RoomVariable})
member.summary: See SetRoomVariablesRequest(ICollection<RoomVariable>, Room) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.SetUserVariablesRequest
member.summary: Sets one or more custom User Variables for the current user.
member.remarks:
When a User Variable is set, the event is dispatched to all the users in all the Rooms joined by the current user, including himself.
NOTE: the event is dispatched to users in a specific Room only if it is configured to allow this event (see the RoomSettings.Permissions parameter).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.SetUserVariablesRequest.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Sfs2X.Entities.Variables.UserVariable})
member.summary: Creates a new SetUserVariablesRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: A collection of objects representing the User Variables to be set.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.SpectatorToPlayerRequest

member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.SpectatorToPlayerRequest.#ctor

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.SubscribeRoomGroupRequest
member.summary: Subscribes the current user to Room-related events occurring in the specified Group.
member.remarks:
This allows the user to be notified of specific Room events even if he didn't join the Room from which the events originated, provided the Room belongs to the subscribed Group.
If the subscription operation is successful, the current user receives a event; otherwise the event is fired.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.SubscribeRoomGroupRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new SubscribeRoomGroupRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The name of the Room Group to subscribe.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.UnsubscribeRoomGroupRequest
member.summary: Unsubscribes the current user to Room-related events occurring in the specified Group.
member.remarks:
This allows the user to stop being notified of specific Room events occurring in Rooms belonging to the unsubscribed Group.
If the operation is successful, the current user receives a event; otherwise the event is fired.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.UnsubscribeRoomGroupRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new UnsubscribeRoomGroupRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The name of the Room Group to unsubscribe.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.AddBuddyRequest
member.summary: Adds a new buddy to the current user's buddies list.
member.remarks:
In order to add a buddy, the current user must be online in the Buddy List system. If the buddy is added successfully, the operation is confirmed by a event; otherwise the event is fired.
This request can be sent if the Buddy List system was previously initialized only (see the request description).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.AddBuddyRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new AddBuddyRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The name of the user to be added as a buddy.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.BlockBuddyRequest
member.summary: Blocks or unblocks a buddy in the current user's buddies list. Blocked buddies won't be able to send messages or requests to that user.
member.remarks:
In order to block a buddy, the current user must be online in the Buddy List system. If the operation is successful, a confirmation event is dispatched; otherwise the event is fired.
This request can be sent if the Buddy List system was previously initialized only (see the request description).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.BlockBuddyRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new BlockBuddyRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The name of the buddy to be blocked or unblocked.
true if the buddy must be blocked; false if he must be unblocked.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.BuddyMessageRequest
member.summary: Sends a message to a buddy in the current user's buddies list.
member.remarks:
Messages sent to buddies using the request are similar to the standard private messages (see the request) but are specifically designed for the Buddy List system: they don't require any Room parameter, nor they require that users joined a Room. Additionally, buddy messages are subject to specific validation, such as making sure that the recipient is in the sender's buddies list and the sender is not blocked by the recipient.
If the operation is successful, a event is dispatched in both the sender and recipient clients.
This request can be sent if the Buddy List system was previously initialized only (see the request description).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.BuddyMessageRequest.#ctor(System.String,Sfs2X.Entities.Buddy,Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject)
member.summary: Creates a new BuddyMessageRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The message to be sent to a buddy.
The Buddy object corresponding to the message recipient.
An instance of containing additional custom parameters (e.g. the message color, an emoticon id, etc). Default is null.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.BuddyMessageRequest.#ctor(System.String,Sfs2X.Entities.Buddy)
member.summary: See BuddyMessageRequest(String, Buddy, ISFSObject) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.GoOnlineRequest
member.summary: Toggles the current user's online/offline state as buddy in other users' buddies lists.
member.remarks:
All clients who have the current user as buddy in their buddies list will receive the event and see the property change accordingly. The same event is also dispatched to the current user, who sent the request, so that the application interface can be updated accordingly. Going online/offline as buddy doesn't affect the user connection, the currently joined Zone and Rooms, etc.
The online state of a user in a buddy list is handled by means of a reserved and persistent Buddy Variable.
This request can be sent if the Buddy List system was previously initialized only (see the request description).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.GoOnlineRequest.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new GoOnlineRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: true to make the current user available (online) in the Buddy List system; false to make him not available (offline).

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.InitBuddyListRequest
member.summary: Initializes the Buddy List system on the current client.
member.remarks: Buddy List system initialization involves loading any previously stored buddy-specific data from the server, such as the current user's buddies list, his previous state and the persistent Buddy Variables. The initialization request is the first operation to be executed in order to be able to use the Buddy List system features. Once the initialization is completed, the event id fired and the user has access to all his previously set data and can start to interact with his buddies; if the initialization failed, a event id fired.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.InitBuddyListRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new InitBuddyListRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.RemoveBuddyRequest
member.summary: Removes a buddy from the current user's buddies list.
member.remarks:
In order to remove a buddy, the current user must be online in the Buddy List system. If the buddy is removed successfully, the operation is confirmed by a event; otherwise the event is fired.
This request can be sent if the Buddy List system was previously initialized only (see the request description).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.RemoveBuddyRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new RemoveBuddyRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The name of the buddy to be removed from the user's buddies list.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.SetBuddyVariablesRequest
member.summary: Sets one or more Buddy Variables for the current user.
member.remarks:
This operation updates the Buddy object representing the user in all the buddies lists in which the user was added as a buddy. If the operation is successful, a event is dispatched to all the owners of those buddies lists and to the user who updated his variables too.
The Buddy Variables can be persisted, which means that their value will be saved even it the user disconnects and it will be restored when he connects again. In order to make a variable persistent, put the constant SFSBuddyVariable.OFFLINE_PREFIX before its name. Read the SmartFoxServer 2X documentaion about the Buddy List API for more informations.
This request can be sent if the Buddy List system was previously initialized only (see the request description) and the current user state in the system is "online".

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Buddylist.SetBuddyVariablesRequest.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{Sfs2X.Entities.Variables.BuddyVariable})
member.summary: Creates a new SetBuddyVariablesRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: A list of objects representing the Buddy Variables to be set.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.CreateSFSGameRequest
member.summary: Creates a new public or private game, including player matching criteria, invitations settings and more.
member.remarks:
A game is created through the istantiation of a SFSGame on the server-side, a specialized Room type that provides advanced features during the creation phase of a game. Specific game-configuration settings are passed by means of the class.
If the creation is successful, a event is dispatched to all the users who subscribed the Group to which the Room is associated, including the game creator. Otherwise, a event is returned to the creator's client.
Also, if the settings passed in the object cause invitations to join the game to be sent, an invitation event is dispatched to all the recipient clients.
Check the SmartFoxServer 2X documentation for a more in-depth overview of the GAME API.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.CreateSFSGameRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings)
member.summary: Creates a new CreateSFSGameRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: An object containing the SFSGame configuration settings.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.InvitationReplyRequest
member.summary: Replies to an invitation received by the current user.
member.remarks:
Users who receive an invitation sent by means of the request can either accept or refuse it using this request. The reply causes an event to be dispatched to the inviter; if a reply is not sent, or it is sent after the invitation expiration, the system will react as if the invitation was refused.
If an error occurs while the reply is delivered to the inviter user (for example the invitation is already expired), an event is returned to the current user.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.InvitationReplyRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Invitation.Invitation,Sfs2X.Entities.Invitation.InvitationReply,Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject)
member.summary: Creates a new InvitationReplyRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: An instance of the Invitation class containing the invitation details (inviter, custom parameters, etc).
The answer to be sent to the inviter, among those available as constants in the class.
An instance of containing custom parameters to be returned to the inviter together with the reply (for example a message describing the reason of refusal). Default is null.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.InvitationReplyRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Invitation.Invitation,Sfs2X.Entities.Invitation.InvitationReply)
member.summary: See InvitationReplyRequest(Invitation, InvitationReply, ISFSObject) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.InviteUsersRequest
member.summary: Sends a generic invitation to a list of users.
member.remarks: Invitations can be used for different purposes, such as requesting users to join a game or visit a specific Room, asking the permission to add them as buddies, etc. Invited users receive the invitation as an event dispatched to their clients: they can accept or refuse it by means of the InvitationReplyRequest request, which must be sent within the specified amount of time.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.InviteUsersRequest.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},System.Int32,Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject)
member.summary: Creates a new InviteUsersRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: A list of objects representing the users to send the invitation to.
The number of seconds available to each invited user to reply to the invitation (recommended range: 15 to 40 seconds).
An instance of containing custom parameters which specify the invitation details.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.QuickJoinGameRequest
member.summary: Quickly joins the current user in a public game.
member.remarks:
By providing a matching expression and a list of Rooms or Groups, SmartFoxServer can search for a matching public Game Room and immediately join the user into that Room as a player.
If a game could be found and joined, the event is dispatched to the requester's client.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.QuickJoinGameRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Match.MatchExpression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},Sfs2X.Entities.Room)
member.summary: Creates a new QuickJoinGameRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: A matching expression that the system will use to search a Game Room where to join the current user.
A list of Group names to which the matching expression should be applied. The maximum number of elements in this list is 32.
An object representing the Room that the user should leave when joining the game. Default is null.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.QuickJoinGameRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Match.MatchExpression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: See QuickJoinGameRequest(MatchExpression, List<string>, Room) constructor.

member.summary: Creates a new QuickJoinGameRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: A matching expression that the system will use to search a Game Room where to join the current user.
A list of Room objects to which the matching expression should be applied. The maximum number of elements in this list is 32.
An object representing the Room that the user should leave when joining the game. Default is null.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings
member.summary: The SFSGameSettings class is a container for the settings required to create a Game Room using the CreateSFSGameRequest request.
member.remarks: On the server-side, a Game Room is represented by the SFSGame Java class which extends the class providing new advanced features such as player matching, game invitations, public and private games, quick game joining, etc. On the client side Game Rooms are regular Rooms with their Room.IsGame property set to true.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new SFSGameSettings instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the class constructor.
member.param: The name of the Game Room to be created.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.IsPublic
member.summary: Indicates whether the game is public or private.
member.remarks:
A public game can be joined by any player whose User Variables match the assigned to the Game Room. A private game can be joined by users invited by the game creator by means of list.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.MinPlayersToStartGame
member.summary: Defines the minimum number of players required to start the game.
member.remarks:
If the property is set to true, when this number is reached, the game start is notified.
The default value is 2.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.InvitedPlayers
member.summary: In private games, defines a list of User objects or Buddy objects representing players to be invited to join the game.
member.remarks:
If the invitations are less than the minimum number of players required to start the game (see the property), the server will send additional invitations automatically, searching users in the Room Groups specified in the list and filtering them by means of the object passed to the property.
The game matching criteria contained in the property do not apply to the users specified in this list.
The default value is an empty list.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.SearchableRooms
member.summary: In private games, defines a list of Groups names where to search players to invite.
member.remarks:
If the users invited to join the game (specified through the property) are less than the minimum number of players required to start the game (see the property), the server will invite others automatically, searching them in Rooms belonging to the Groups specified in this list and filtering them by means of the object passed to the property.
The default value is null.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.InvitationExpiryTime
member.summary: In private games, defines the number of seconds that the users invited to join the game have to reply to the invitation.
member.remarks: The suggested range is 10 to 40 seconds. Default value is 15.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.LeaveLastJoinedRoom
member.summary: In private games, indicates whether the players must leave the previous Room when joining the game or not.
member.remarks:
This setting applies to private games only because users join the Game Room automatically when they accept the invitation to play, while public games require a request to be sent, where this behavior can be determined manually.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.NotifyGameStarted
member.summary: Indicates if a game state change must be notified when the minimum number of players is reached.
member.remarks:
If this setting is true, the game state (started or stopped) is handled by means of the reserved Room Variable represented by the ReservedRoomVariables.RV_GAME_STARTED constant. Listening to the event for this variable allows clients to be notified when the game can start due to minimum number of players being reached.
As the used Room Variable is created as global (see the class description), its update is broadcast outside the Room too: this can be used on the client-side, for example, to show the game state in a list of available games.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.PlayerMatchExpression
member.summary: Defines the game matching expression to be used to filters players.
member.remarks:
Filtering is applied when:
users try to join a public Game Room as players (their User Variables must match the matching criteria);
the server selects additional users to be invited to join a private game (see the property).
Filtering is not applied to users invited by the creator to join a private game (see the property).
The default value is null.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.SpectatorMatchExpression
member.summary: Defines the game matching expression to be used to filters spectators.
member.remarks:
Filtering is applied when users try to join a public Game Room as spectators (their User Variables must match the matching criteria).
The default value is null.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.SFSGameSettings.InvitationParams
member.summary: In private games, defines an optional object containing additional custom parameters to be sent together with the invitation.
member.remarks:
This object must be an instance of . Possible custom parameters to be transferred to the invitees are a message for the recipient, the game details (title, type...), the inviter details, etc.
The default value is null.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.JoinRoomInvitationRequest
member.summary: Sends an invitation to other users/players to join a specific Room.
member.remarks:
Invited users receive the invitation as an event dispatched to their clients: they can accept or refuse it by means of the InvitationReplyRequest request, which must be sent within the specified amount of time.
Depending on the Room's settings this invitation can be sent by the Room's owner only or by any other user. This behavior can be set via the RoomSettings.AllowOwnerOnlyInvitation parameter.
NOTE: spectators in a Game Room are not allowed to invite other users; only players are.
An invitation can also specify the amount of time given to each invitee to reply. Default is 30 seconds. A positive answer will attempt to join the user in the designated Room. For Game Rooms the asSpectator flag can be toggled to join the invitee as player or spectator (default = player).
There aren't any specific notifications sent back to the inviter after the invitee's response. Users that have accepted the invitation will join the Room while those who didn't reply or turned down the invitation won't generate any event. In order to send specific messages (e.g. chat), just send a private message back to the inviter.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.JoinRoomInvitationRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Room,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new JoinRoomInvitationRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The Room to join (must have free user/player slots).
A list of user names to invite.
An instance of containing any relevant parameter or message to be sent to the invited users (for example an invitation message). Default is null.
The time given to the invitee to reply to the invitation. Default is 30.
In Game Rooms only, indicates if the invited user(s) should join as spectator(s) instead of player(s). Default is false.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.JoinRoomInvitationRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Room,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: See JoinRoomInvitationRequest(Room, List<string>, ISFSObject, int, bool) constructor.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.JoinRoomInvitationRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Room,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject)
member.summary: See JoinRoomInvitationRequest(Room, List<string>, ISFSObject, int, bool) constructor.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Game.JoinRoomInvitationRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Room,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: See JoinRoomInvitationRequest(Room, List<string>, ISFSObject, int, bool) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MMORoomSettings
member.summary: The MMORoomSettings class is a container for the settings required to create an MMORoom using the CreateRoomRequest request.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MMORoomSettings.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new MMORoomSettings instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the class constructor.
member.param: The name of the MMORoom to be created.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MMORoomSettings.DefaultAOI
member.summary: Defines the Area of Interest (AoI) for the MMORoom.
member.remarks:
This value represents the area/range around the user that will be affected by server events and other users events. It is represented by a Vec3D object providing 2D or 3D coordinates.
Setting this value is mandatory.
member.example:
A Vec3D(50,50) describes a range of 50 units (e.g. pixels) in all four directions (top, bottom, left, right) with respect to the user position in a 2D coordinates system.
A Vec3D(120,120,60) describes a range of 120 units in all four directions (top, bottom, left, right) and 60 units along the two Z-axis directions (backward, forward) with respect to the user position in a 3D coordinates system.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MMORoomSettings.MapLimits
member.summary: Defines the limits of the virtual environment represented by the MMORoom.
member.remarks:
When specified, this property must contain two non-null Vec3D objects representing the minimum and maximum limits of the 2D/3D coordinates systems. Any positional value that falls outside the provided limit will be refused by the server.
This setting is optional but its usage is highly recommended.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MMORoomSettings.UserMaxLimboSeconds
member.summary: Defines the time limit before a user without a physical position set inside the MMORoom is kicked from the Room.
member.remarks:
As soon as the MMORoom is joined, the user still doesn't have a physical position set in the coordinates system, therefore it is considered in a "limbo" state. At this point the user is expected to set his position (via the request) within the amount of seconds expressed by this value.
The default value is 50 seconds.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MMORoomSettings.ProximityListUpdateMillis
member.summary: Configures the speed at which the PROXIMITY_LIST_UPDATE event is sent by the server.
member.remarks:
In an MMORoom, the regular users list is replaced by a proximity list, which keeps an updated view of the users currently within the Area of Interest of the current user. The speed at which these updates are fired by the server is regulated by this parameter, which sets the minimum time between two subsequent updates.
The default value is 250 milliseconds.
NOTE: values below the default might be unnecessary for most applications unless they are in realtime.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MMORoomSettings.SendAOIEntryPoint
member.summary: Sets if the users entry points in the current user's Area of Interest should be transmitted in the PROXIMITY_LIST_UPDATE event.
member.remarks:
If this setting is set to true, when a user enters the AoI of another user, the server will also send the coordinates at which the former "appeared" within the AoI. This option should be turned off in case these coordinates are not needed, in order to save bandwidth.
The default value is true.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MapLimits
member.summary: The MapLimits class is used to set the limits of the virtual environment represented by an MMORoom when creating it.
member.remarks: The limits represent the minimum and maximum coordinate values (2D or 3D) that the MMORoom should expect.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MapLimits.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Data.Vec3D,Sfs2X.Entities.Data.Vec3D)
member.summary: Creates a new MapLimits instance.
member.remarks: The property must be set to this instance during the MMORoom creation.
member.param: The lower coordinates limit of the virtual environment along the X,Y,Z axes.
The higher coordinates limit of the virtual environment along the X,Y,Z axes.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MapLimits.LowerLimit
member.summary: Returns the lower coordinates limit of the virtual environment along the X,Y,Z axes.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.MapLimits.HigherLimit
member.summary: Returns the higher coordinates limit of the virtual environment along the X,Y,Z axes.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.SetUserPositionRequest
member.summary: Updates the User position inside an MMORoom.
member.remarks:
MMORooms represent virtual environments and can host any number of users. Based on their position, the system allows users within a certain range from each other (Area of Interest, or AoI) to interact.
This request allows the current user to update his position inside the MMORoom, which in turn will trigger a PROXIMITY_LIST_UPDATE event for all users that fall within his AoI.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.SetUserPositionRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Data.Vec3D,Sfs2X.Entities.Room)
member.summary: Creates a new SetUserPositionRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: The user position.
The MMORoom object corresponding to the Room where the position should be set; if null, the last Room joined by the user is used.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.MMO.SetUserPositionRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Data.Vec3D)
member.summary: See SetUserPositionRequest(Vec3D, Room) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest
member.summary: In SmartFoxServer 2X Cluster environment, quickly joins the current user in a public game on a Game Node, or creates a new game if none is found.
member.remarks:
The Lobby Node searches for a public Game Room that meets the criteria expressed by the passed matching expression in the passed Room Groups. If no suitable Game Room can be found or a null matching expression is passed, and if the settings parameter is set, a new Game Room is created on a Game Node selected by the cluster's load balancing system.
In any case, if a game to join can be found or is created, the event is dispatched to the requester's client, followed by a event after the connection and login process is completed. In case the client is already connected to the target Game Node, the event is received immediately.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Match.MatchExpression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings)
member.summary: Creates a new ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest instance.
member.param: A matching expression that the system will use to search a Game Room where to join the current user; if null, a new Game Room will be created.
A list of group names to further filter the search; if null, all groups will be searched.
If no Rooms are found through the matching expression, a new Room with the passed settings will be created and the user will auto-join it.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Match.MatchExpression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: See ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest(MatchExpression, List<string>, RoomSettings) constructor.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Match.MatchExpression)
member.summary: See ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest(MatchExpression, List<string>, RoomSettings) constructor.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings)
member.summary: See ClusterJoinOrCreateRequest(MatchExpression, List<string>, RoomSettings) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterRoomSettings
member.summary: The ClusterRoomSettings class is a container for the settings required to create a Game Room on a Game Node in a SmartFoxServer 2X Cluster.
member.remarks: On the server-side, a Game Room is represented on the Game Node by the SFSGame Java class which extends the class providing advanced features such as player matching, game invitations, public and private games, quick game joining, etc. On the client side Game Rooms are regular Rooms with their Room.IsGame property set to true.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterRoomSettings.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ClusterRoomSettings instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the class constructor.
member.param: The name of the Game Room to be created.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterRoomSettings.IsPublic
member.summary: Indicates whether the game is public or private.
member.remarks:
A public game can be joined by any player. A private game can only be joined by users invited by the game creator by means of list.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterRoomSettings.MinPlayersToStartGame
member.summary: Defines the minimum number of players required to start the game.
member.remarks:
If the property is set to true, when this number is reached, the game start is notified.
The default value is 2.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterRoomSettings.InvitedPlayers
member.summary: In private games, defines a list of Buddy or User objects representing players to be invited to join the game.
member.remarks: The default value is an empty list.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterRoomSettings.InvitationExpiryTime
member.summary: In private games, defines the number of seconds that the users invited to join the game have to reply to the invitation.
member.remarks: The suggested range is 30 to 60 seconds. Default value is 30.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterRoomSettings.NotifyGameStarted
member.summary: Indicates if a game state change must be notified when the minimum number of players is reached.
member.remarks:
If this setting is true, the game state (started or stopped) is handled by means of the reserved Room Variable represented by the ReservedRoomVariables.RV_GAME_STARTED constant. Listening to the event for this variable allows clients to be notified when the game can start due to minimum number of players being reached.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterRoomSettings.InvitationParams
member.summary: In private games, defines an optional object containing additional custom parameters to be sent together with the invitation.
member.remarks:
This object must be an instance of . Possible custom parameters to be transferred to the invitees are a message for the recipient, the game details (title, type...), the inviter details, etc.
The default value is null.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterTarget
member.summary: The ClusterTarget class is a container for the identifier of a Room on a Game Node in a SmartFoxServer 2X Cluster.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterTarget.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new ClusterTarget instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the class constructor.
member.param: The identifier of the Game Node where the Room is located.
The identifier of the Room on the Game Node.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterTarget.ServerId
member.summary: Indicates the identifier of the Game Node where the Room is located.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterTarget.RoomId
member.summary: Indicates the identifier of the Room on the Game Node.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterInviteUsersRequest
member.summary: In the SmartFoxServer 2X Cluster environment, sends a generic invitation to a list of users to join a Room on a Game Node.
member.remarks:
Invited users receive the invitation as an event dispatched to their clients: they can accept or refuse it by means of the InvitationReplyRequest request, which must be sent within the specified amount of time.
If the invitation is accepted, and the invited user is not yet connected to the target Game Node, the event is dispatched to the their client, followed by a event after the connection and login process is completed. In case the client is already connected to the target Game Node, the event is received immediately.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterInviteUsersRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Requests.Cluster.ClusterTarget,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},System.Int32,Sfs2X.Entities.Data.ISFSObject)
member.summary: Creates a new ClusterInviteUsersRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: An instance of containing the identifiers of the Game Node and Room the users are invited to join.
A list of objects representing the users to send the invitation to.
The number of seconds available to each invited user to reply to the invitation (recommended range: 15 to 40 seconds).
An instance of containing custom parameters which specify the invitation details.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Requests.QuickJoinOrCreateRoomRequest
member.summary: Quickly joins the current user in a public Room, or creates a new Room if none is found.
member.remarks:
SmartFoxServer searches for a public Room that meets the criteria expressed by the passed matching expression in the passed Room Groups. If no suitable Room can be found, a new Room is created, based on the passed settings.
If a Room is created, the event is dispatched to all the users who subscribed the Group to which the Room is associated, including the Room creator. In any case, if a Room to join could be found or was created, the event is then dispatched.
Error conditions (Room creation error, Room join error) should always be checked adding the appropriate listeners.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.QuickJoinOrCreateRoomRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Match.MatchExpression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings,Sfs2X.Entities.Room)
member.summary: Creates a new QuickJoinOrCreateRoomRequest instance.
member.remarks: The instance must be passed to the SmartFox.Send method for the request to be performed.
member.param: A matching expression that the system will use to search a Room where to join the current user.
A list of group names to further filter the search; if null, all groups will be searched.
If no Rooms are found through the matching expression, a new Room with the passed settings will be created and the user will auto-join it.
An object representing the Room that the user should leave when joining the game. Default is null.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Requests.QuickJoinOrCreateRoomRequest.#ctor(Sfs2X.Entities.Match.MatchExpression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},Sfs2X.Requests.RoomSettings)
member.summary: See QuickJoinOrCreateRoomRequest(MatchExpression, List<string>, RoomSettings, Room) constructor.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Util.ClientDisconnectionReason
member.summary: The ClientDisconnectionReason class contains the costants describing the possible reasons why a disconnection from the server occurred.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.Util.ClientDisconnectionReason.IDLE
member.summary: Client was disconnected because it was idle for too long.
member.remarks: The connection timeout depends on the server settings.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.Util.ClientDisconnectionReason.KICK
member.summary: Client was kicked out of the server.
member.remarks: Kicking can occur automatically (i.e. for swearing, if the words filter is active) or due to the intervention of a user with enough privileges (i.e. an administrator or a moderator).

member.name: F:Sfs2X.Util.ClientDisconnectionReason.BAN
member.summary: Client was banned from the server.
member.remarks: Banning can occur automatically (i.e. for flooding, if the flood filter is active) or due to the intervention of a user with enough privileges (i.e. an administrator or a moderator).

member.name: F:Sfs2X.Util.ClientDisconnectionReason.MANUAL
member.summary: The client manually disconnected from the server.
member.remarks: The method on the SmartFox class was called.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.Util.ClientDisconnectionReason.UNKNOWN
member.summary: A generic network error occurred, and the client is unable to determine the cause of the disconnection.
member.remarks: The server-side log should be checked for possible error messages or warnings.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Util.BlueBoxCfg
member.summary: The BlueBoxCfg class stores the configuration parameters for the BlueBox connection. When a socket connection fails the BlueBox can help the client connect to the server via HTTP tunnel.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.BlueBoxCfg.IsActive
member.summary: Indicates whether the SmartFoxServer's BlueBox should be enabled or not.
member.remarks: The default value is true.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.BlueBoxCfg.UseHttps
member.summary: Forces the BlueBox connection to use an HTTPS tunnel instead of standard HTTP.
member.remarks: IMPORTANT NOTE: this mode should be used exclusively if you're deploying your app to iOS devices, since Apple doesn't accept HTTP connections. All other platforms should always use standard HTTP, because the protocol is already encrypted when cryptography is activated. In other words the BlueBox transmits an encrypted protocol over a standard HTTP tunnel, which is perfectly secure.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.BlueBoxCfg.PollingRate
member.summary: Specifies the BlueBox polling speed.
member.remarks: The default value is 750.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.BlueBoxCfg.Proxy
member.summary: Proxy server settings for the BlueBox.
member.remarks: These should be used only if the client can only access HTTP services via a proxy server. Connection via proxy server is not supported under Universal Windows Platform.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Util.ProxyCfg
member.summary: The ProxyCfg class stores the proxy server settings for the BlueBox.
member.remarks: Connection via proxy server is not supported under Universal Windows Platform.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ProxyCfg.Host
member.summary: Specifies the IP address of the proxy server.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ProxyCfg.Port
member.summary: Specifies the port number of the proxy server.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ProxyCfg.BypassLocal
member.summary: Indicates whether the proxy server should be bypassed for local addresses or not.
member.remarks: Default value is true.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ProxyCfg.UserName
member.summary: User name for the proxy server authentication.
member.remarks: Use only if the proxy server requires authentication.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData
member.summary: The ConfigData class stores the client configuration data loaded from an external XML file or passed directly to the deputy connect method.
member.remarks: The external configuration file is loaded by the SmartFox class when its SmartFox.LoadConfig() method is called. Otherwise it can be passed directly to one of the SmartFox.Connect(ConfigData) method overloads of the SmartFox class.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.Host
member.summary: Specifies the IP address or host name of the SmartFoxServer 2X instance to connect to (TCP connection).
member.remarks:
The default value is 127.0.0.1.
When using a websocket connection to an IPv6 address, always wrap the address in square brackets.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.Port
member.summary: Specifies the TCP port of the SmartFoxServer 2X instance to connect to (TCP connection).
member.remarks: The default value is 9933.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.UdpHost
member.summary: Specifies the IP address of the SmartFoxServer 2X instance to connect to (UDP connection).
member.remarks: The default value is 127.0.0.1.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.UdpPort
member.summary: Specifies the UDP port of the SmartFoxServer 2X instance to connect to (UDP connection).
member.remarks: The default value is 9933.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.Zone
member.summary: Specifies the Zone of the SmartFoxServer 2X instance to join.
member.remarks: The default value is null.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.Debug
member.summary: Indicates whether the client-server messages debug should be enabled or not.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.HttpPort
member.summary: Specifies the port for generic HTTP communication.
member.remarks: The default value is 8080.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.HttpsPort
member.summary: Specifies the port for HTTPS communication.
member.remarks: For example this parameter is required during the initialization of an encrypted connection. The default value is 8443.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.TcpNoDelay
member.summary: Indicates whether SmartFoxServer's TCP socket is using the Nagle algorithm or not.
member.remarks: This setting must be false to use the Nagle algorithm; otherwise, true. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.Util.ConfigData.BlueBox

member.summary: Helper class for logging in with a pre-hashed password.
member.remarks:
This is needed if your server-side database stores User passwords hashed with MD5.
For more information see the Sign Up Assistant component tutorial (Password Mode section).

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Util.PasswordUtil.MD5Password(System.String)
member.summary: Generates the MD5 hash of the user password.
member.param: The plain text password.
member.returns: The hashed password.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.Util.SFSErrorCodes
member.summary: The SFSErrorCodes class provides a mean of translation between server error codes and their relative error messages.
member.remarks:
Error messages are provided by default in the English language but they can be localized and substituted in any other language. The error messages contain special placeholders that are processed at runtime and substituted with runtime data. They are in the form of a number enclosed in curly brackets such as: {0}, {1}, etc. Please make sure you maintain these placeholders while translating the messages.
For more informations please visit this link: http://docs2x.smartfoxserver.com/AdvancedTopics/client-error-messages.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.Util.SFSErrorCodes.SetErrorMessage(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the text of the error message corresponding to the passed error code.
member.remarks: Make sure to maintain all the placeholders while modifying the messages.
member.param: The code of the error message to be modified.
The new error message, including the placeholders for runtime informations.
member.example:
The following example shows how to translate error 13 to French language retaining the required placeholders:
SFSErrorCodes.SetErrorMessage(13, "Le Groupe demand n'est pas disponible - Salle: {0}; Groupe: {1}");

member.name: T:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseEventArgs
member.summary: Represents the event data for the event.

remarks.para: The close event occurs when the WebSocket connection has been closed.
If you would like to get the reason for the connection close, you should access the or property.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseEventArgs.Code
member.summary: Gets the status code for the connection close.

value.para: A that represents the status code for the connection close.
1005 (no status) if not present.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: Gets the reason for the connection close.

value.para: A that represents the reason for the connection close.
An empty string if not present.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseEventArgs.WasClean
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the connection has been closed cleanly.
member.value: true if the connection has been closed cleanly; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode
member.summary: Indicates the status code for the WebSocket connection close.

remarks.para:
The values of this enumeration are defined in
Section 7.4 of RFC 6455.
"Reserved value" cannot be sent as a status code in closing handshake by an endpoint.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Normal
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1000. Indicates normal close.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Away
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1001. Indicates that an endpoint is going away.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.ProtocolError
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1002. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.UnsupportedData
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1003. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data that it cannot accept.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Undefined
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1004. Still undefined. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.NoStatus
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1005. Indicates that no status code was actually present. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Abnormal
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1006. Indicates that the connection was closed abnormally. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.InvalidData
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1007. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that contains data that is not consistent with the type of the message.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.PolicyViolation
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1008. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.TooBig
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1009. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big to process.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.MandatoryExtension
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1010. Indicates that a client is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server did not return them in the handshake response.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.ServerError
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1011. Indicates that a server is terminating the connection because it has encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.TlsHandshakeFailure
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1015. Indicates that the connection was closed due to a failure to perform a TLS handshake. A Reserved value.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Logger
member.summary: Provides a set of methods and properties for logging.

remarks.para: If you output a log with lower than the current logging level, it cannot be outputted.
The default output method writes a log to the standard output stream and the text file if it has a valid path.
If you would like to use the custom output method, you should specify it with the constructor or the property.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.WebSocket
member.summary: Implements the WebSocket interface.

remarks.para: This class provides a set of methods and properties for two-way communication using the WebSocket protocol.
The WebSocket protocol is defined in RFC 6455.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.EmptyBytes
member.summary: Represents the empty array of used internally.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.FragmentLength
member.summary: Represents the length used to determine whether the data should be fragmented in sending.

remarks.para: The data will be fragmented if its length is greater than the value of this field.
If you would like to change the value, you must set it to a value between 125 and Int32.MaxValue - 14 inclusive.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.RandomNumber
member.summary: Represents the random number generator used internally.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.#ctor(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified URL and optionally subprotocols.

param.name: url
param.para: A that specifies the URL to which to connect.
The scheme of the URL must be ws or wss.
The new instance uses a secure connection if the scheme is wss.

param.name: protocols
param.para: An array of that specifies the names of the subprotocols if necessary.

Each value of the array must be a token defined in
RFC 2616.

exception.para: is an invalid WebSocket URL string.
contains a value that is not a token.

member.exception: The set operation is not available if the interface is not for the client.

member.name: P:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the HTTP Origin header to send with the handshake request.

remarks.para:
The HTTP Origin header is defined in
Section 7 of RFC 6454.
The interface sends the Origin header if this property has any.
The set operation works if the current state of the interface is New or Closed.

value.para: A that represents the value of the Origin header to send.
The syntax is <scheme>://<host>[:<port>].
The default value is .

member.exception: The set operation is not available if the interface is not for the client.

exception.para: The value specified for a set operation is not an absolute URI string.
The value specified for a set operation includes the path segments.

A set of the certificate files is a pair of <port number>.cer (DER) and <port number>.key (DER, RSA Private Key).

member.name: T:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode
member.summary: Indicates the HTTP status code that can be specified in a server response.
member.remarks: The values of this enumeration are defined in RFC 2616.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Continue
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 100. Indicates that the client should continue with its request.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 101. Indicates that the server is switching the HTTP version or protocol on the connection.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.OK
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 200. Indicates that the client's request has succeeded.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Created
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 201. Indicates that the client's request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Accepted
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 202. Indicates that the client's request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 203. Indicates that the returned metainformation is from a local or a third-party copy instead of the origin server.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NoContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 204. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the client's request but does not need to return an entity-body.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ResetContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 205. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the client's request, and the user agent should reset the document view which caused the request to be sent.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PartialContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 206. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the partial GET request for the resource.

summary.para: Equivalent to status code 300. Indicates that the requested resource corresponds to any of multiple representations.
MultipleChoices is a synonym for Ambiguous.
Equivalent to status code 300. Indicates that the requested resource corresponds to any of multiple representations.
Ambiguous is a synonym for MultipleChoices.
Equivalent to status code 301. Indicates that the requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URI and any future references to this resource should use one of the returned URIs.
MovedPermanently is a synonym for Moved.
Equivalent to status code 301. Indicates that the requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URI and any future references to this resource should use one of the returned URIs.
Moved is a synonym for MovedPermanently.
Equivalent to status code 302. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
Found is a synonym for Redirect.
Equivalent to status code 302. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
Redirect is a synonym for Found.
Equivalent to status code 303. Indicates that the response to the request can be found under a different URI and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.
SeeOther is a synonym for RedirectMethod.
Equivalent to status code 303. Indicates that the response to the request can be found under a different URI and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.
RedirectMethod is a synonym for SeeOther.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotModified
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 304. Indicates that the client has performed a conditional GET request and access is allowed, but the document has not been modified.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.UseProxy
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 305. Indicates that the requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by the Location field.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unused
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 306. This status code was used in a previous version of the specification, is no longer used, and is reserved for future use.

summary.para: Equivalent to status code 307. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
TemporaryRedirect is a synonym for RedirectKeepVerb.
Equivalent to status code 307. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
RedirectKeepVerb is a synonym for TemporaryRedirect.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadRequest
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 400. Indicates that the client's request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 401. Indicates that the client's request requires user authentication.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PaymentRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 402. This status code is reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Forbidden
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 403. Indicates that the server understood the client's request but is refusing to fulfill it.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 404. Indicates that the server has not found anything matching the request URI.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 405. Indicates that the method specified in the request line is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotAcceptable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 406. Indicates that the server does not have the appropriate resource to respond to the Accept headers in the client's request.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 407. Indicates that the client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 408. Indicates that the client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Conflict
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 409. Indicates that the client's request could not be completed due to a conflict on the server.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Gone
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 410. Indicates that the requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.LengthRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 411. Indicates that the server refuses to accept the client's request without a defined Content-Length.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 412. Indicates that the precondition given in one or more of the request headers evaluated to false when it was tested on the server.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 413. Indicates that the entity of the client's request is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 414. Indicates that the request URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 415. Indicates that the entity of the client's request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 416. Indicates that none of the range specifier values in a Range request header overlap the current extent of the selected resource.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 417. Indicates that the expectation given in an Expect request header could not be met by the server.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.InternalServerError
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 500. Indicates that the server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the client's request.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 501. Indicates that the server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the client's request.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadGateway
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 502. Indicates that a gateway or proxy server received an invalid response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 503. Indicates that the server is currently unable to handle the client's request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 504. Indicates that a gateway or proxy server did not receive a timely response from the upstream server or some other auxiliary server.

member.name: F:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 505. Indicates that the server does not support the HTTP version used in the client's request.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpUtility.htmlEncode(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the specified string to an HTML-encoded string.

remarks.para: This method starts encoding with a NCR from the character code 160 but does not stop at the character code 255.
One reason is the unicode characters ＜ and ＞ that look like < and >.

member.returns: A that represents an encoded string.
member.param: A to encode.
A : true if encodes without a NCR; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpUtility.initEntities
member.summary: Initializes the _entities field.
member.remarks: This method builds a dictionary of HTML character entity references. This dictionary comes from the HTML 4.01 W3C recommendation.

member.name: T:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Server.HttpServer
member.summary: Provides a simple HTTP server.

remarks.para: The server supports HTTP/1.1 version request and response.
Also the server allows to accept WebSocket handshake requests.
This class can provide multiple WebSocket services.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: The new instance listens for incoming requests on and port 80.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified port.

remarks.para: The new instance listens for incoming requests on and .
It provides secure connections if is 443.

member.param: An that specifies the number of the port on which to listen.
member.exception: is less than 1 or greater than 65535.

member.name: M:Sfs2X.WebSocketSharp.Server.HttpServer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified URL.

remarks.para: The new instance listens for incoming requests on the IP address and port of .
Either port 80 or 443 is used if includes no port. Port 443 is used if the scheme of is https; otherwise, port 80 is used.
The new instance provides secure connections if the scheme of is https.

member.param: A that specifies the HTTP URL of the server.

member.exception: The value specified for a set operation is .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the server is allowed to be bound to an address that is already in use.

remarks.para: You should set this property to true if you would like to resolve to wait for socket in TIME_WAIT state.
The set operation works if the current state of the server is Ready or Stop.

The default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate used to find the credentials for an identity.

The method must return if the credentials are not found.
if not necessary.
